page.title: 09SOUTH YORKS. WATER AUTHORITY
page.content:
There is a quarry south of the railway, producing for Hepworth Iron Company which manufacturers pipes at a site a few miles away.
Part of the reservoirs at Royd Moor and Scout Dyke are included in this area. There are numerous other reservoirs just outside the area. These contain water for use some distance away; the water for local use coming from bore holes in the valley. Scout Dyke reservoir, completed in l928, has a reinfroced earth dam, and can be used for fishing, canoeing, and sub-aqua activities. It's maximum depth is 12.2 metres. The public is not allowed access to the other reservoirs. Royd Moor, maximum depth 19.2 metres also has an earth dam and was completed in l934. Although they are man-made the reservoirs blend in
